abstract:
We determine the exact strong converse exponent of classical-quantum channel
coding, for every rate above the Holevo capacity. Our form of the exponent is
an exact analogue of Arimoto's, given as a transform of the R\'enyi capacities
with parameters $\alpha>1$. It is important to note that, unlike in the
classical case, there are many inequivalent ways to define the R\'enyi
divergence of states, and hence the R\'enyi capacities of channels. Our
exponent is in terms of the R\'enyi capacities corresponding to a version of
the R\'enyi divergences that has been introduced recently in [M\"uller-Lennert,
Dupuis, Szehr, Fehr and Tomamichel, J. Math. Phys. 54, 122203, (2013)], and
[Wilde, Winter, Yang, Commun. Math. Phys. 331, (2014)]. Our result adds to the
growing body of evidence that this new version is the natural definition for
the purposes of strong converse problems.
